name: Wood chip briquette production; at plant
description: This unit process dataset represents the production of 1 dry ton of wood chip briquette from wood chips using RUF200 model briquette (RUF Briquetting Systems, Zaisertshofen,Germany) in Big Lagoon, California. Additional details on the process can be found in Alanya-Rosenbaum et al (2018).

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The primary data were collected from the production site in Big Lagoon, California during July-August 2015.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Briquettes are produced using RUF200 model briquetter (RUF Briquetting Systems, Zaisertshofen,Germany), which uses dried woodchips generated from forest residues as feedstock. Capacity of 200 kg/hr.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription: No environmental emissions data were collected, the input/output data were obtained onsite.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Secondary data were taken from the USLCI database (NREL, 2017).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data could represent the Western United States in 2015. Data development is demonstrated by parameterization (presents all raw data and calculations). Contact USFS for parameter information.

processDocumentation.intendedApplication: These data were developed as specific, average or generic unit process or LCI results data sets for use in accounting “Accounting” level LCAs (Situation A). A full inventory of environmental flows are included, thus this unit process can be used for a full range of LCIA impact categories, once the appropriate fate and transport considerations have been applied.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: The U.S. Department of Energy under the Biomass Research and Development Initiative program: Award Number DE-EE0006297. This study was part of one of these BRDI projects called Waste to Wisdom (www.waste-towisdom.com).

dataSetOwner.name: United States Forest Service, Forest Products Laboratory

sources.name: Unit Process for Wood Chip Briquette Production, 2016

exchanges.description: Production of one dry ton of wood chip briquette by use of briquetter.

Primary data collected from operational runs
